item.title: Nuclear Weapons and International Stability
item.description: I recommend reading Eric Schlosser’s Command and Control, but if you don’t have time for that, this series of videos from the William J Perry Project is about as sobering: Nuclear Weapons and International Stability (YouTube playlist)

item.title: Robot Vaccuums
item.description: Getting a robot vacuum a few years ago was a game-changer for me. It’s not quite as big of a change as, say, getting a dishwasher would be, but it’s hard to understate how nice it is to not have to worry about day-to-day “maintenance” vacuuming. I’d been fairly satisfied with the Ecovacs Deebot for a few years. I think it was a Wirecutter top pick at one point. That said, it really only seemed to work well for cleaning single rooms in one go.
